availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert B. Herron (Highland County, Ohio, student and chaplain 14th Ky Inf. USA)

body.p: Highland County, Ohio, student, chaplain, and soldier. Ohio native. Student in Highland County in 1850. Student in Highland County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as chaplain from April 28, 1863, to September 18, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Highland County, Hillsborough, p. 47A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Highland County, Union, p. 168.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 872.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 274.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #495055, Certificate #318730.
U.S. Enrollment of Civil War Veterans Kansas, 1889, p. 254 of 737 microfilm.
Find A Grave, "R. B. Herron (1834-1899)," Memorial #55146641, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/55146641 (accessed November 28, 2020).
